Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: When a piece of pure silicon is doped with aluminium, then
options: the conductivity of the doped silicon piece will remain the same
the doped silicon piece will become n-type
the doped silicon piece will become p~type
the resistivity of the doped silicon piece will increase
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: the doped silicon piece will become p~type
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Aluminium is a p-type dopant, which means that when a semiconductor (silicon in this case) is doped with aluminium, it creates a hole (positively charged carrier) by accepting an electron from the silicon atom. Electrical conductivity of semiconductors increase and resistivity remains same.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Which one of the following is not a semiconductor?
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Semiconductors are solid substances that show electrical conductivity either with the addition of an impurity or because of temperature effects. Silicon, Germanium, and Galium Arsenide are semiconductors as they show electrical conductivity depending on the addition of impurity and temperature. Quartz is an insulator.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: A photon of X-ray has energy of 1 keV. A photon of visible radiation has energy of 3 eV. In this context, which one of the following statements is not correct?
options: The wavelength of X-ray photon is less than the wavelength of visible radiation photon.
Both the photons have different energies.
The speeds of both the photons in vacuum are different.
The frequency of X-ray photon is higher than the frequency of visible radiation photon.
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: The speeds of both the photons in vacuum are different.
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Electromagnetic radiation consists of photons which move at speed of light within a vacuum.

Physics (Modern Physics).subject: Physics (Modern Physics)
Physics (Modern Physics).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
options: The cathode rays originate from cathode and proceed towards the anode in a cathode-ray discharge tube.
The television picture tubes are nothing but cathode-ray tubes.
The cathode rays themselves are not visible.
The characteristics of cathode rays depend upon the nature of the gas present in the cathode-ray tube.
Physics (Modern Physics).answer: The characteristics of cathode rays depend upon the nature of the gas present in the cathode-ray tube.
Physics (Modern Physics).explanation: Cathode ray is a beam of electrons emitted from the cathode of a vacuum tube. It is invisible. Cathode ray tubes are also found in televisions and computer monitors. Since cathode ray is a beam of electrons and all electrons are identical, charge to mass ratio is same for all the gases and does not depend on the nature of gas.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: Suppose voltage V is applied across a resistance R, The power dissipated in the resistance is P. Now the same voltage V is applied across a parallel combination of three equal resistors each of resistance R. Then the power dissipated in the second case will be
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Power (P) across a resistor = V2/R; In the first case, P1 = V2/R. In the second case, equivalent resistant of parallel combination = R/3. Power in second case (P2) = (V2)/(R/3) = 3V2/R, So, P1/P2 = 1/3 or P2 = 3P1

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: A parallel-plate capacitor, with air in between the plates, has capacitance C. Now the space between the two plates of the capacitor is filled with a dielectric of dielectric constant 7. Then the value of the capacitance will become
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Capacitance = K * Îo * A / d. [A = Area of each plate. Îo = Permittivity of free space. d = distance between plate. k1 = dielectric constant.] Since, K1 = 7, hence new capacitance will be 7C.

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: A copper wire of radius r and length l has a resistance of R. A second copper wire with radius 2r and length l is taken and the two wires are joined in a parallel combination. The resultant resistance of the parallel combination of the two wires will be
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: R = P * l/A. The new resistance will be R/4 and resultant resistance will be R/5

Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).subject: Physics (Electricity & Magnetism)
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).question: A parallel-plate capacitor of capacitance C1 is made using two gold plates. Another parallel-plate capacitor of capacitance C2 is made using two aluminium plates with same plate separation, and all the four plates are of same area. If rg and ra are respectively the electrical resistivities of gold and aluminium, then which one of the following relations is correct?
Physics (Electricity & Magnetism).explanation: Capacitance is defined as the ability of a system to store electric charge and can be calculated by the formula, C = Q/V, where ‘Q’ is the charge stored on each plate and ‘V’ is the applied electric potential across the plates capacitors. Capacitance does not depend on the electrical resistivities of the material of capacitors.

Physics (Mechanics).subject: Physics (Mechanics)
Physics (Mechanics).question: For which one of the following does the centre of mass lie outside the body?
Physics (Mechanics).explanation: The centre of mass of a body is the point where the whole mass of a body is considered to be concentrated. It may lie within or outside the body of an object. Fountain pen, cricket ball and book are all compact body and their centre of gravity lie within the body. The centre of mass of a ring is at its centre which is outside its body.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: Consider the electromagnetic radiations having wavelengths 200 nm, 500nm and 1000 nm. Which wavelength(s) of the following can make visual sensation to a human eye?
Physics (Optics).explanation: Visual sensation or the perceptual experience of seeing an object is related to the visible spectrum, which is the region of the electromagnetic radiation that is visible to the human eye. Electromagnetic radiation in this range of wavelengths (390-700 nm) is called visible light. 200 and 1000 nm do not lie in the visible range of wavelength.

Physics (Optics).subject: Physics (Optics)
Physics (Optics).question: The optical phenomenon that is primarily responsible for the observation of rainbow on a rainy day is
Physics (Optics).explanation: Rainbow can be seen on a rainy day due to the phenomena of dispersion, which is an optical process involving splitting of white light into its constituent colors while passing through a lighter to heavier medium. On a rainy day, white light gets dispersed into its seven colors while passing through rain drops.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question: Polynucleotide chain of DNA contains
options: a nitrogenous base, deoxyribose sugar and phosphate group
a nitrogenous base, ribose sugar and phosphate group
deoxyribose sugar, ribose sugar and phosphate group
a nitrogenous base and phosphate group only
Genetics.answer: a nitrogenous base, deoxyribose sugar and phosphate group
Genetics.explanation: DNA is made up of many nucleotides joining together, called polynucleotide chain of DNA. Each polynucleotide is made up of three components: (i) nitrogenous base [such as adenine (A), guanine (G), cytocine (C) and thymine (T)], (ii) deoxyribose sugar, and (iii) phosphate group.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question: The process of copying genetic information from one strand of DNA into RNA is termed as
Genetics.explanation: The process by which the genetic information in a strand of DNA is copied into a new molecule of messenger RNA (mRNA) is termed as transcription. It is carried out by an enzyme called RNA polymerase and a number of accessory proteins called transcription factors.

Genetics.subject: Genetics
Genetics.question: Syngamy results in formation of
Genetics.explanation: Syngamy is the process of fusion of two cells or their nucleus during reproduction. More particularly, it can be said that syngamy is fusion of one male gamete with egg cell and leads to formation of diploid zygote.

Health and Disease.subject: Health and Disease
Health and Disease.question: In human body, the cell growth and differentiation are highly controlled and regulated, but in cancer cells
options: there is breakdown of these regulatory mechanisms leading to formation of benign and malignant tumors
controlled cell division and over- production of genetic material occur
RNA is mutated and produced in less amount
DNA is mutated and produced in less amount
Health and Disease.answer: there is breakdown of these regulatory mechanisms leading to formation of benign and malignant tumors
Health and Disease.explanation: In cancer, there is unwanted cell proliferation leading to uncontrolled cell division. Some cancers may spread into other tissues. Mutation is the main cause of cancer at genetic level. Mutation causing agents are called carcinogens, such as UV radiation, tobacco and tobacco smoke, pesticides, etc.

Microbiology.subject: Microbiology
Microbiology.question: Most viruses that infect plants possess
Microbiology.explanation: In general, plant viruses have single-stranded RNA. Animal viruses have either single or double-stranded RNA or double-stranded DNA. Bacterial viruses usually have double stranded DNA.

Nutrition.subject: Nutrition
Nutrition.question: Bleeding of gums, falling of teeth, fragile bones and delayed wound healing occur due to the deficiency of which one of the following vitamins?
Nutrition.explanation: Vitamin C is needed to produce skin, tendons, ligaments, and blood vessel. It is also needed in repair of bones and teeth. Deficiency of vitamin C results in bleeding of gums, falling of teeth, weak bones and delay in wound healing.

Human Physiology.subject: Human Physiology
Human Physiology.question: The mammalian heart is myogenic and it is regulated by nerves. The heartbeat originates from
Human Physiology.explanation: Heart beat originates from sinoatrial node, a group of cells situated in the upper part of the right atrium wall. The electrical impulses causing the heart beat are generated in sinoatrial node. Hepatic portal system comprises hepatic portal vein and veinlets. T wave depicts repolarization of heart ventricles. QRS wave are three waves seen on a electrocardiogram.

Botany.subject: Botany
Botany.question: The plant growth regulators are small, simple molecules of diverse chemical composition. They are
options: indole compounds, adenine derivatives, carotenoids and terpenes
vitamin C, vitamin D and glucose
Botany.answer: indole compounds, adenine derivatives, carotenoids and terpenes
Botany.explanation: Plant growth regulators or plant hormones (phytohormones) are chemicals that control plant growth, e.g. auxins, gibberellins, cytokinins, abscisic acid and ethylene. Auxin is composed of indole-3-acetic acid. Cytokinins are derivatives of the nitrogenous purine base adenine. Some plant hormones are also composed of derivatives of carotenoids and terpenes.
